Overview

Creating and managing users on the fly to enable them to take up an interview or to review a Test report has been made easy using the JIT (Just-in-Time) provisioning.

With JIT enabled, a user can be created just-in-time, which allows for an instant login without the need for the user to have been manually created in HackerRank, beforehand. The data required to provision the user comes from the SSO response after the user is authenticated, which must be configured in your chosen identity provider (IdP). JIT is the fastest and least friction to create a new account.

This article guides you on configuring JIT (Just-inTime) provisioning for HackerRank. To know about SSO and its benefits, refer to the article Getting started with SSO.

Note: HackerRank accepts only the user's email address. In the setup, the user defines the SAML assertion with the necessary data. HackerRank SSO fails if it receives anything other than an email address.

Prerequisites

  • You must have an active HackerRank for Work account with Company admin access.

Enabling JIT SSO on HackerRank Account

    1. Access the Settings page of your HackerRank for Work account.
    2. Click Single Sign-On on the left pane.
    3. Enable SSO.
    4. Navigate to the Just-in-Time Provisioning section.
    5. Enter the email domain for which you require the JIT provisioning. For example, hackerrank.com.
      Note: When a user logs in with this domain, JIT automatically creates a license for the user, and the user will be able to log in through the SSO.
    6. By default, the role for the new users is assigned as Recruiter.
    7. The team the user belongs to is optional and is assigned to No Team by default.
    8. Click Save & Enable to save the changes.

Signing In to HackerRank Account with JIT SSO

  1. Navigate to the HackerRank for Work Login page. The Google for work login is displayed along with the HackerRank login.
  2. Click Continue with Google to log in to your HackerRank account.

    The Choose an account page is displayed that shows all your Google for Work accounts.

  3. Select an account that you have already used to log in to HackerRank. It must be your work account.

FAQs

If your company enforces login through SSO, you will not be authenticated based on your Google account. After you select your Google account for login, you will be redirected to your SSO provider.
title: Setting Up HackerRank SSO with Just-in-Time
